title: Who is the best baritone saxophone player on today's jazz scene? - Quora

response.answer_text: Without question the great Ronnie Cuber.  He is a Baritone player of  powerfully melting fluency and melody, allied to a supreme command of the axe.  Put it like this: the Tenor had Michael Brecker (RIP), Alto David Sanborn, and the Baritone has Ronnie Cuber!  Oh, he’s also good on other horns and he also composes and orchestrates too. ‘nuff said!

James Carter. Mostly because he’s the only living one I know and he’s from my hometown. But the guy is amazing! He’d come into Baker’s Keyboard Lounge on open mic night and just blow the roof of the place. I’ve had the pleasure of seeing him there a few times, and at Bert’s in the market once. Each time he just showed up unannounced and just threw down.
